alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 01 at 3:18PM MST until January 01 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snowmelt from higher elevations is expected along Oak Creek. * WHERE...Along Oak Creek through Oak Creek Canyon to Sedona. * WHEN...Until 800 AM MST Monday /800 AM MST Monday/. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flooding over private low-water crossings and bridges over Oak Creek that are used to access businesses and homes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 309 PM MST /309 PM MST/, Rain continues over the Oak Creek Canyon area. Oak Creek has already risen due to a combination of rainfall and snowmelt upstream at higher elevations. Flooding of low water crossings is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sedona, Slide Rock State Park, Garland`s Oak Creek Lodge, Junipine Resort, Manzanita Campground and Red Rock State Park. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
